intro: Drymonia ovata, commonly known as the round-leafed drymonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its ovate, glossy leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Drymonia ovata typically grows in wetland habitats, such as swamps and marshes, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland conservation.
